text: Bottle @Craigs (The Budget week tasting). Pours brown with a slightly off white head. Nose is raisins, cake, malty, spices. Taste is more of the same as the nose, a bit like a sticky toffee pudding. Should get an extra 0.1 for the art work.

Roodbruin, crèmekleurige foamy schuimkraag, veel koolzuur, troebel. 
Aroma: Spicy hops, graan, karamel, toffee, moutig, biscuit, zoetig en licht fruitig/ donker fruit.
Smaak: Eerste zoetig en karameltonen, toffee daarna de kruidigheid en peperig van de Spalt hops met daarna een volle moutige smaak. Ergens tussenin nog wat fruitigheid / fruitige esters uit de gist en een redelijke bitter.
Body is medium, mondgevoel is prikkelig met wat koolzuur, afdronk is kruidig en zoet... iets plakkerig.
Bottle at Craigs. Hazy dark amber with a thin off-white head. Aromas of treacle, brown sugar, spice. Taste is caramel, light fruit. Sweet finish.
Bottle at Craigs. Deep reddish brown. Nose is red fruits and berries, malts, caramel, some light spices. Tastes caramel, marmalade, toffee. Quite nice.
bottle at home ... copper brown ... thin tan lacing ... soft sweet spiced fruit toffee malt nose .. juicy sweet toffee fruit ... soft toffee malts .. oily toffee fruits .. sticky toffee fruit ...
Bottle at Craigs. Pours reddish orange, nose is malty toffee, biscuity, orange, spiced, taste is sweet, fruity, juicy, caramel.

THT-datum van Oktober 2016.
Aroma: rode druiven, donker fruit, bronwater.

Smaak: vijgen, wat rode druiven, beetje wijn, moutig en waterig.

Niet geweldig.

Second time to drink a bottle at home. Dark ruby pour with a light tan head. Aroma is malts, caramel, something dry & dark that reminds of dried figs and rye bread, but also a slight chemical tone. Taste is medium sweet, caramel, with a bitter in the finish. Rather soft carbonation. Its an OK beer, but not that special. Uiltje has done so many better ones.
Aromat karmelowy, trochę kawy, marcepana i orzechów. Smak idzie w tym samym kierunku, dodaje tylko trochę kwasu. Bardzo przyzwoite

33cl bottle at home. Appearance: slightly hazy amber with medium eggshell-white head. Aroma: fruits, fruit esters, a bit spicy, caramel, figs. Taste: pretty high sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of caramel, malts, figs and spices. The taste is a bit dusty. Plate: medium bodied, sticky taste and medium carbonation.

Bottle at home. Nicely cloudy dark brown colour, beige foamy head. Caramel malty, light spice, some hoppy bitterness in the finish: well done, nothing special happening. Good body, medium carbonation.

33cl flesje via Hoppy Brothers, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 8,5%
Uitgeschonken in Grimbergen glas

Uiterlijk: roodbruin met redelijke schuimkraag

Aroma en smaak: geur niet zo aangenaam, smaak is donker fruit, zoet van rijp fruit als vijg, caramel, klein bittertje, licht bloemig hopje op het laatst 

Conclusie: mindere neus, lekkere smaken voor de rest

My last rating on Beerbuddy/Ratebeer, going to Untappd as the last admin was calling me too shitty to search myself as I was helping to add this beer for the same reason as the last rating and barcode could not be found (after 50 ratings). 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

1° The Dog was Austrian, not German. OK, so they confess on the label. But 2° On the newer label (not the one above, Commissaris is spelled as Commisaris, and the database, of course, is unable to find that...  Good, very dense & fine yellowish head over clear deep mahogany beer. Caramel, marzipan, almonds, nose hampered by the dense head. Bitterish, leafy, caramel flavours. Even a point of acidity. Dry-ish, even with the caramel. Just some marzipan in the finish. Rather well-bodied, very slick but not thick. Once, long before Ratebeer, I described Uerige Alt as having an unparallelled bitterbite. Weve come a long way. This is probably more hoppy, it just doesnt give us that impression anymore...

Bottle at home. Pours a slight hazy brown reddish colour with a medium sized head which rapidly recedes to a thin layer on top. Aroma of dark malts, mocca, roasted malts, caramel. Taste is fairly sweet, light bitter woth a sweet finish. Notes of roasted malts, caramel, candy sugar. Texture is ouly, medium bodied woth average carbonation
very special, the only thing slightly wrong with it is that it is a little too sweet, but the chalky, dusty dry palate is great. Wonderful
Mahogany brown colour with thin head. Has a strong, full malty taste but with strong floral overtones

Bottle, BB 10.2016 (from het biermoment). Pours dark copper with beige head. The head stays forever. Aroma is sweet, bready, malty, yeasty, and caramelly. Flavor is sweet and bitter, fruits, malt, medicinal notes, caramel, bread. Finish is sweet and malty with some dry bitterness. Body is surprisingly light for the ABV. Drinkability is good. Overall: very good, maybe bit sweet.
Bottle. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty weak caramel aroma. Fruity malty spicy caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty caramel finish.
Pours rather unclear redbrown. Small white head. Smell is bit banana, some caramel. Taste is mildly bitter, buttery, German yeast.ok

Aroma: fruity, toffee, grain, some corn and basement notes
Taste: light sweet, toffee, corn, grain, some fruity notes

33cl bottle from a trade with idserda, many thanks! Pours clear light reddish brown colour with a mid-sized most good lasting off-white head. Aroma of dark malt, red fruits, spruce and some wood. Taste of sweet dark malt, red malt, caramel, red fruits, toffee, cookies, nice!
Aromat i smak słodowy, słodki. Biszkopty, karmel, cukier kandyzowany z niuansami owoców suszonych. Pełne.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a clear bourgundy with a pinkish white heead and an aroma of overripe plums, brown sugar, toffee, raisins and some slight earthy hop. The taste is medium sweet with sweet carbonation and some medium but lasting hoppiness in the finish.

330ml bottle. Dark amber/brown. Off-white head. Aroma of leafy, resinous hops and some brown sugar. Heavy, earthy taste, more brown sugar, toffee, varnish, berries. Hops balancing out the sweetness. Good stuff.

Bottled. Full 33cl sample. The aroma has sugar, caramel, orange. Hazy, brown coloured beer with a thin, lasting, off-white head. The taste is moderate bitter, light-moderate sweet, has oranges, caramel, bit raisin, some citric hop tones, hint of strawberry. Medium dry, slightly sticky mouthfeel. Very good.

Aroma:

Slight/medium aroma of malts, caramel, nuts, fruit and hops.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque ruby/brown beer with a slight/medium beige/brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel and fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with nuts and hops.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense and balanced, but lacks complexity. The caramel malts and slight hops work great together in making this a flavourful beer.
2016 - 06 - 28 330ml bottle. brown colour. medium, tan head. light fruity aroma, hints of chcoclate, wood and smoke. bitter sweet taste.
Bottle 0,33ltr: Dark brown colored brew with an dry bitter taste with some fine hints of fruitiness and some chocolate. Heavy Düsseldorfer Alt inspired beer from Dutch Haarlem.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy dark Coca Cola brown pour with a smooth magnolia head, aroma is bready and some sweet malts, taste has floral action, malt loaf, red fruits, some bitter chocolate.

Draught @ Kaapse BAF15, [ Borefts After Beer Festival 2015. ] @ Kaapse Brouwers, Veerlaan 19D, Rotterdam, Netherlands 3072 AN. [ As Uiltje Commissaris Rex ].Unclear - hazy medium brown - red amber color with a small to average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, moderae yeasty, yeast, weizen bock alike. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, yeast, caramel, sweet malt - yeast. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150927]

Draft @ Café Rootzzz. Pours a deep dark brown beer with a small amount of light beige head on top. Aroma is very malt forward, light amount of dried fruits and grass. Flavor is fairly bitter, certainly compared to other Alts Ive had. Not sure if its a hoppy bitterness or a herbal bitterness, but not really enjoying it to be fair. Still a nice Alt, low in carbonation and thin bodied, still easy drinkable despite the higher abv. Strange variation of the style.

Nice thick head, ruby red. Immediately smells of dark hops. Very bittersweet aroma, long aftertaste. Malty, hoppy, dark sugar. Very nice carbonization and a bit oily. Simple, but very refreshing and pretty good.
Bottle at home, brown amber beer, medium to small head. Aroma is sweet, malty, dark fruit. Taste is the same, some bitterness. Not bad.

07-02-2016, Delft, flink gegist

Ambergekleurd met een lichtbruine gloed. Redelijke schuimkraag. Vrij verassend bier. Valt niet echt binnen binnen bepaald type, heeft zelfs wat weg van een IPA. Smaakt verassend goed. Relatief veel alcohol maar drinkt makkelijk weg. Smaak:

Bottle @ Dont want anything to do with carnaval tasting. Nice clear dark red dark amber color, small to average sized off-white to beige head. Smell and taste malts, a bit perfumy, slightly a touch of hops, sweetish, a hint of brown malts, slightly bitter. Decent body and carbonation.

Bottle @ benzais carnaval. Clear ruby to brown colour with a small off-white head. Smells hops, fresh, fruity, sweet, raisin, red fruits. Tastes sweet, some hops, fresh, nice. Thin to medium body, soft carbo.

(Het Uiltje Commissaris Rex) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into an altbier glass, ABV 8.5%
Dark amber colour on the body, two fingers tall beige head, thick, with great retention.
Nice fruity aroma, a little bit of tangerine in there and maybe grapefruit, light caramel and toasted malts.
Citrusy and hoppy taste, much more different than what you expect from an Altbier, not necessarily bad of course. Caramel as well, some malts too. Quite bitter for the style.
Medium body, good carbonation and very dry on the palate.
This altbier made by Het Uiltje is surely better than many of the german made ones.

33cl bottle at home from Flink Gegist, Delft. Body is non-transparent reddish brown, head is medium, beige, creamy, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is malty, flavor is chocolate, dried fruits, mild roasted malt, brown sugar, old wood. Medium sweet, medium bitter, hint of fruity sour. Finish is medium lasting roasty medium bittersweet, light umami. Full body, oily texture, nearly flat carbonation. Simple dessert beer, quite good.
mandarijn achtige hop...sorachi? bavarian? caramel, rozijnen/suiker.. licht bitter en zoet... hoppige afdronk met wat mandarijn... lekker en zeer interessant

Tasting thuis, fles van mij, bij ABCbeers vandaan. Vreemd apparaat deze woefwoef. Lijkt een blend van bockbier / ipa / dunkelweizen, met extra alcohol. Niet de beste uil. Wel creatief!! Backlog from 2015/11/05.

schenkt rood/bruin met schuimige fijne kaki kraag. aroma van een scotch ale, caramel, hop, kruiden, rozijn. smaken zijn redelijk suiker zoet, matig bitter,m rozijn, redelijk caramel moutige smaken, droog, snoepjes zoet, graan,gras, medium body, dun en glad van textuur, lage co2, lange kruidige zoetige en iets droge afdronk. prima alt-bier !

33cl Bottle from drankgigant.nl. Dark amber-brown colour, creamy light - beige head. Aroma of floral and grassy hops, sweet nuts, caramel, toast, something herbal. Flavour is medium sweet, malty, caramel, nuts, toast, floral hops, bitter finish. Medium to full bodied. Good.

Bottled from Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Dark brown colored, small beige head. Malty nose, caramel, molasses, hint of iron. Bittersweet flavor, malts, some caramel, again the iron. Reminds me a bit of Westmalle Dubbel, malty without being overly sweet. A bit harsh, may need some aging to make it a smoother. OK beer.
Bottle. dark amber color. Malt, raisin and soft herbal notes in the aroma. Malty sweetish, herbal caramelly flavor with raisin. Slightly alcoholic. Medium bodied. Soft grassy notes. Nice.

33cl Apperance: A very dark brown with big light beige head. 
Aroma: Sweet citrus notes, caramel, dark bread, rye. tones, ice tea ?
Taste: Fruity starter but then a dark more herbal, leaver earthy bitterness. Full bodiy with soft carbonation.
Not as good as the best Germans but still quite good.

Bottle 33cl. Clear deep amber brown, small froty beige head, good lacing; earthy aroma, caramel, brown sugar, milk chocolate, basement, dried dark fruits, fallen autumn leaves; taste is medium sweet and bitter, toffee, spicy notes; medium body, oily to creamy texture, soft carbonation, bittersweet aftertaste, bit on the bland side, caramellish and spicy notes at the end; quite complex and odd brew, nice though, does however miss the refinement and elegance of the real thing.

Sweet candied aroma. Taste is not as sweet as expected. Still some bitterness with a medium body. Not bad but not my thing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Chocolade bruine kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt zoetig mout, kruiden. Smaakt zoetig, kruiden chocolade, beetje bitter in de afdronk.

0.33 l bottle from De Bierkoning, best before October 2016. Clear, dark reddish amber with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, tan head. Sweetish, fruity-malty aroma of raisins, caramel and brown sugar. Sweetish-malty, sligthly fruity taste of caramel, brown sugar and some raisins, followed by short, slightly bitter and lightly spicy finish (no alcohol). Medium to full body, creamy to oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Highly drinkable, but lacking (at 8.5%) the deepness and complexity of for instance Ueriges Doppelsticke. Expected a bit more, still very nice though.
Bottle. Ruby copper color. Aroma of caramel, malt, cinnamon and some amber. Taste of buttery caramel, mild pine, creamy malt and some grassy bitters. Allright.

Bottle at home. Aroma of malt, caramel, toffee, bread, raisins, light herbal notes, fruity notes. Flavour is medium sweet with a moderate to medium bittersweet finish. A bit sticky. Body is medium to full. My first "Doppelsticke". Definitely more tasty than the average Altbier.

Bottle shared thanks to Sjogro. Very dark brown with big light beige head. Sweet citrus notes, lots of hops on the nose, burnt sugar, dark brown bread, light rye, touch of vegetables. Nice fruity up front, but slight rotten, vegetal and rotten leaves notes in the finish. Medium sweet and bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Strange stuff, not really my thing.

33cl bottle shared at home. Somewhat hazy amber brown with a medium off-white head. Light to medium body with low to moderate carbonation. Nice well balanced bitter and sweet tones. Caramel, malts, grain, some hops and herbs. Tasty!

bottle at home, bought at our local bottle shop. poured a very dark murky brown colour with a off head. really a horrible colour. nose has caramel malts, bread, grains, sticky caramel, earth, cloves, raising and a hint of sweet dried pluums. mouthfeel is pretty sticky and full bodied. slight ashy note. nice brew. to bad for the bad pour
Bottle from biernavigatie.nl. Brown colour, beige foam. Medium carbonation. Sweet nose of caramel. Bitter hops. Metallic hints. Good altbier.

33cl bottle bought at ABC Beers, The Hague, The Netherlands.
Brown with small head. Sweet flavor, slightly bitter and soft carbonation.

Bottle from ABC Beers, Den Haag. poured a murky dark brown with a frothy light tan head. The aroma is yeast, light sweet malt. The flavour is moderate bitter with a dry yeast, light grassy hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

33cl bottle from ABCBeers shared with JMGReenUK.
Thick creamy off white head. Very hazy amber pour. Decent.

[9/27/15] Draught sample at Borefts After Festival 2015 in Rotterdam. Murky brown. Aroma of yeast, malt, caramel, and some leafy hops. Sweetish flavor with malt, caramel, and a mildly bitterish finish. Medium-bodied.

Thx! for sharing. Sampled draft @ BAF 2015. Dark brown, creamy mocha head. Nose is sweetish blue cheese hops, (Sorachi Ace?), caramel, sweet caramel, light milk chocolate, brown sugar, mocha. Taste is sweetish caramel mixed with brown sugar, caramel, blue cheese, sugar, milk chocolate, Sweet creamy, caramel body. Delicious sweet mocha & blue cheese goodness. Really nice.

Draft at Kaapse BAF 15. Pours cloudy orange brown with a small tan head. Aroma of light fruits, citrus, orange peel, malt, caramel and toffee. Flavour is over moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Tap @ Borefts After Festival 15, small sample. Slight hazy copper color, short head. Aroma of caramel and toffee, bit earthy and grassy hop. Soft bitter in taste, sweet caramel. Nicely balanced. Good doppelsticke!
